englishSentence.sentence: Tell me and I forget. Teach me and I remember. Involve me and I learn.
englishSentence.author: Benjamin Franklin

englishSentence.sentence: A pessimist is one who makes difficulties of his opportunities and an optimist is one who makes opportunities of his difficulties.
englishSentence.author: Harry S. Truman

englishSentence.sentence: Always remember that you are absolutely unique. Just like everyone else.
englishSentence.author: Margaret Mead

englishSentence.sentence: An unexamined life is not worth living.
englishSentence.author: Socrates

englishSentence.sentence: Challenges are what make life interesting and overcoming them is what makes life meaningful.
englishSentence.author: Joshua J. Marine

englishSentence.sentence: Don’t judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant.
englishSentence.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

englishSentence.sentence: Education is not the filling of a pail but the lighting of a fire.
englishSentence.author: William Butler Yeats

englishSentence.sentence: Every man is a poet when he is in love.
englishSentence.author: Plato

englishSentence.sentence: Genius only means hard-working all one’s life.
englishSentence.author: Mendeleyev

englishSentence.sentence: Happiness lies not in the mere possession of money; it lies in the joy of achievement, in the thrill of creative effort.
englishSentence.author: Franklin Roosevelt

englishSentence.sentence: I am a slow walker, but I never walk backwards.
englishSentence.author: Abraham Lincoln

englishSentence.sentence: I can’t change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination.
englishSentence.author: Jimmy Dean

englishSentence.sentence: I didn’t fail the test. I just found 100 ways to do it wrong.
englishSentence.author: Benjamin Franklin

englishSentence.sentence: I disapprove of what you say, but I will defend to the death your right to say it.
englishSentence.author: Voltaire

englishSentence.sentence: If I looked compared to others far, is because I stand on giant’s shoulder.
englishSentence.author: Newton

englishSentence.sentence: If you can’t fly, then run; if you can’t run, then walk; if you can’t walk, then crawl; but whatever you do, you have to keep moving forward.
englishSentence.author: Martin Luther King

englishSentence.sentence: If you don’t like something, change it; if you can’t change it, change the way you think about it.
englishSentence.author: Mary Engelbreit

englishSentence.sentence: If you have no critics, you will likely have no success.
englishSentence.author: Malcolm S. Forbes

englishSentence.sentence: If you judge people, you have no time to love them.
englishSentence.author: Mother Teresa

englishSentence.sentence: If you look at what you have in life, you’ll always have more. If you look at what you don’t have in life, you’ll never have enough.
englishSentence.author: Oprah Winfrey

englishSentence.sentence: Imagination is more important than knowledge.
englishSentence.author: Albert Einstein

englishSentence.sentence: Intelligence plus character – that is the goal of real education.
englishSentence.author: Martin Luther King

englishSentence.sentence: It is not how much you do, but how much love you put into the doing that matters.
englishSentence.author: Mother Teresa

englishSentence.sentence: Knowledge is a treasure, but practice is the key to it.
englishSentence.author: British churchman  Thomas Fuller

englishSentence.sentence: Knowledge is power.
englishSentence.author: Francis Bacon

englishSentence.sentence: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance you must keep moving.
englishSentence.author: Albert Einstein

englishSentence.sentence: Living without an aim is like sailing without a compass.
englishSentence.author: Alexandre Dumas

englishSentence.sentence: Love the life you live. Live the life you love.
englishSentence.author: Bob Marley

englishSentence.sentence: Love well, whip well.
englishSentence.author: Benjamin Franklin

englishSentence.sentence: Never argue with stupid people, they will drag you down to their level and then beat you with experience.
englishSentence.author: Mark Twain

englishSentence.sentence: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
englishSentence.author: Winston Churchill

englishSentence.sentence: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched. They must be felt with the heart.
englishSentence.author: Helen Keller

englishSentence.sentence: The first wealth is health.
englishSentence.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

englishSentence.sentence: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
englishSentence.author: Nelson Mandela

englishSentence.sentence: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.
englishSentence.author: Franklin Roosevelt

englishSentence.sentence: The only way to do great work is to love what you do. If you haven’t found it yet, keep looking. Don’t settle.
englishSentence.author: Steve Jobs

englishSentence.sentence: The ordinary focus on what they’re getting. The extraordinary think about who they’re becoming.
englishSentence.author: Robin Sharma

englishSentence.sentence: The past cannot be changed. The future is yet in your power.
englishSentence.author: Mary Pickford

englishSentence.sentence: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.
englishSentence.author: Dalai Lama

englishSentence.sentence: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
englishSentence.author: Walt Disney

englishSentence.sentence: There are seven things that will destroy us: wealth without work; pleasure without conscience; knowledge without character; religion without sacrifice; politics without principle; science without humanity; business without ethics.
englishSentence.author: Mahatma Gandhi

englishSentence.sentence: Those who dare to fail miserably can achieve greatly.
englishSentence.author: John F. Kennedy

englishSentence.sentence: Try not to become a man of success but rather try to become a man of value.
englishSentence.author: Albert Einstein

englishSentence.sentence: Until we can manage time, we can manage nothing else.
englishSentence.author: Peter F. Drucker

englishSentence.sentence: We must accept finite disappointment, but we must never lose infinite hope.
englishSentence.author: Martin Luther King

englishSentence.sentence: When the whole world is silent, even one voice becomes powerful.
englishSentence.author: Malala

englishSentence.sentence: When we are saying this cannot be accomplished, this cannot be done, then we are short-changing ourselves. My brain, it cannot process failure. It will not process failure.
englishSentence.author: Kobe Bryant

englishSentence.sentence: Where there is a will, there is a way.
englishSentence.author: Thomas Edison

englishSentence.sentence: You have to believe in yourself. That’s the secret of success.
englishSentence.author: Charles Chaplin

englishSentence.sentence: You must be the change you want to see in the world.
englishSentence.author: Gandhi
